description:
## ARIA

If the progress bar is describing the loading progress of a particular region of a page,
you should use `aria-describedby` to point to the progress bar, and set the `aria-busy`
attribute to `true` on that region until it has finished loading.
propClasses: Override or extend the styles applied to the component.
propColor: The color of the component. It supports those theme colors that make sense for this component.
propDisableShrink:
If `true`, the shrink animation is disabled.
This only works if variant is `indeterminate`.
propSize:
The size of the circle.
If using a number, the pixel unit is assumed.
If using a string, you need to provide the CSS unit, e.g '3rem'.
propValue:
The value of the progress indicator for the determinate variant.
Value between 0 and 100.
propVariant:
The variant to use.
Use indeterminate when there is no progress value.
stylesRoot: Styles applied to the root element.
stylesDeterminate: Styles applied to the root element if `variant="determinate"`.
stylesIndeterminate: Styles applied to the root element if `variant="indeterminate"`.
stylesColorPrimary: Styles applied to the root element if `color="primary"`.
stylesColorSecondary: Styles applied to the root element if `color="secondary"`.
stylesCircle: Styles applied to the `circle` svg path.
stylesCircleDeterminate: Styles applied to the `circle` svg path if `variant="determinate"`.
stylesCircleIndeterminate: Styles applied to the `circle` svg path if `variant="indeterminate"`.
stylesCircleDisableShrink: Styles applied to the `circle` svg path if `disableShrink={true}`.
